ygData.subject: Re: AC and weight...
ygData.msgSnippet: I didnt notice a big problem with weight until  Ihit 12.  then the difference between 14 and 15 ment the difference between loosing 1 bubble during a fight,
ygData.messageBody:
I didnt notice a big problem with weight until Ihit 12. then the
difference between 14 and 15 ment the difference between loosing 1 bubble
during a fight, and running for my life.

I kept my guild tunic, and picked up a couple peices of cloth. by 10, get
yourself some netted gloves. once you can hunt wisps, you can start
building up a collection of mesh (money becomes very unimportant once you
can hunt wisps).

On 24 Aug 1999 Xurlus@... wrote:

> From: Xurlus@...
>
> Hail all, I am a relatively new member of the EverQuest family.On the E'Chi world I just reached 8th lvl, moments ago actualy, And have many Q's regarding the intricacies of playing the ever loved Monk. I read in some of the recent posts about AC-weight considerations and would like to "trim the fat" so to speak from my armor.
> As of now I have a Leather, shirt, pants, shoulder, gloves, mask, cap, A cloth cape a mesh bracers and raw hide boots. Now keeping in mind that I am working with a tight budget, Nay, make that a VERY tight budget, what whould be your suggestions on what I should keep/acquire.
> Thank you for your time.
> Zarvitz
> 8th lvl monk.
>
